author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: The Governor of Gombe calls for prayers for Nigeria from Muslim pilgrims
text:
In a farewell address at the Gombe State Muslim Pilgrims Welfare Board office, Governor Muhammadu Yahaya urged the state’s intending pilgrims to pray for the challenges facing citizens of the state and the country as they embark on their spiritual journey to the Holy Land.
A total of 1,370 intending pilgrims are set for this year’s Hajj, with airlifting beginning on Saturday.
Governor Inuwa Yahaya spoke about the country’s current socio-economic realities and emphasized the importance of intensified prayers for Allah’s intervention in these challenging times.
He stressed the need for prayers for a successful harvest to combat high food prices in the markets, stating that only divine intervention can help the country overcome its multifaceted challenges.
The governor advised the pilgrims to represent their state and country well while in Saudi Arabia, urging them to uphold their integrity and avoid actions that could tarnish their reputation.
He reminded them of the consequences of misconduct in the Holy Land, emphasizing the importance of following the law and maintaining a positive image.
As they prepared for the Hajj experience, Governor Yahaya assured the pilgrims of his administration’s commitment to providing a seamless journey from Nigeria to the Holy Land, promising timely airlifts for all participants.
He called on all officials involved in the Hajj operation to carry out their responsibilities with honesty, dedication, and patriotism to ensure a successful pilgrimage.
The Executive Secretary of the Gombe State Muslim Pilgrims Welfare Board, Sa’adu Hassan, expressed gratitude to the governor for his unwavering support and efforts to make the Hajj operation run smoothly.
He acknowledged the governor’s assistance to the pilgrims, including provisions for animal sacrifices, free food on Arafat Day, and financial support during the pilgrimage.
Additionally, the Emir of Dukku, His Royal Highness Haruna Rasheed, commended Governor Yahaya for his support of the Hajj operations, citing special interventions that have benefited Gombe pilgrims.
